agency_desc: A nonprofit that provides support to Veterans and their families.

agency_desc: A faith-based, nonprofit organization that provides safety, food, and shelter for pregnant and parenting women.
service_description: Provides safety, education, support, food, and shelter for pregnant women and their unborn baby. Support services include case management, parenting, on-site therapy, job search assistance, life skills, and more. Each woman is eligible to remain in the program until the baby's first birthday.
site_details: Call or visit website to apply.
site_eligibility: Pregnant women who are homeless or at risk of being homeless; must be pregnant to get into program -- Women with children are not accepted -- Income must be at or below 150% of Federal Poverty Guidelines -- Must be able to follow rules and structure of the program -- Must participate in all program requirements, including but not limited to individual therapy, able to pass a drug screen, and commit to living drug and alcohol free.

agency_desc: Provides a host home where parents may voluntarily have their children cared for while seeking to restore stability in their lives.  Host Families provide a loving home for children and Family Coaches come alongside parents to give support and mentorship during the time of a crisis.
service_description: Provides crisis and respite care for children whose parents are temporarily unable to care for them due to a short-term emergency, such as hospitalization, or a longer-term crisis, such as drug abuse, incarceration, homelessness, domestic violence, or unemployment. Care is provided in the homes of trained, volunteer host families.
site_details: Call the crisis line to begin the intake process. -- Callers will need to explain their family situation and provide each child's medical background and Medicaid number (if applicable). -- Leave a voicemail with family situation and contact information for a return call.
site_eligibility: Ages 0-20 years-old -- Note: Youth with severe behavioral problems may be screened out.

site_schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8am-5pm -- Home Visits: By appointment

agency_desc: A nonprofit that provides prenatal health education and social support to women through home-based services.
service_description: Provides a smoking cessation program with individualized counseling for pregnant women. Requires four prenatal meetings during pregnancy and then monthly meetings after delivery. Clients may select a smoking support partner, who resides with them, to enroll.  Participants who remain smoke-free throughout the pregnancy and first year of the baby's birth may each qualify for a $25 diaper voucher each month, to be redeemed at participating Walmarts.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: Pregnant women, with or without a smoking support partner (living in same household) -- Currently smoking or smoked at least 3 months prior to pregnancy -- Willing to quit smoking and submit to a breath/saliva test

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization seeking to strengthen support systems through mentoring, empowerment, and advocacy of those needing recovery support services.
service_description: Distributes "Safe Smoke," "Safe Inject," and "Safe Snort" kits to encourage safe drug use and decrease risk of harm or death. Overdose intervention instructions and Naloxone/Narcan are included. Recipients are asked to provide basic demographic information.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Kits may be requested via the form at www.projectme-fw.org/requestsupport, through private message on the agency’s Facebook page, email, phone, or text. -- Staff will respond within 24 hours to coordinate drop-off.
site_eligibility: Age 18 or older -- Living in Allen County

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization seeking to strengthen support systems through mentoring, empowerment, and advocacy of those needing recovery support services.
service_description: Offers Naloxone/Narcan and fentanyl test strips, free of charge, through a partnership with the Overdose Lifeline. Recipients are asked to complete a brief training and provide demographic information.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Submit request, including desired number of doses, via the form at www.projectme-fw.org/general-8 or by phone. -- Staff will respond within 48 hours to coordinate drop-off or pickup. -- Brief training and demographics collection will take place prior to issuing doses.
site_eligibility: Age 18 or older -- Living in Allen County

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization seeking to strengthen support systems through mentoring, empowerment, and advocacy of those needing recovery support services.
service_description: Offers one-on-one nonclinical services with a Certified Addictions Peer Recovery Coach to engage, educate, and support those working to sustain recovery from substance use. Coaches also provide guidance throughout the recovery process to aid clients in overcoming barriers, making informed decisions, and goalsetting. Services may complement, or be an alternative to, clinical treatment and other interventions.
taxonomy_name: Substance Use Disorder Peer Recovery Coach Services
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
nameLevel4: Substance Use Disorder Peer Recovery Coach Services
site_details: Support may be requested via the form at www.projectme-fw.org/requestsupport, in the website's "Need to Talk?" chat feature, through private message on the agency’s Facebook page, email, phone, or text. -- Staff will respond within 48 hours to gather basic information and schedule an intake appointment.
site_eligibility: Age 14 or older -- Living in Adams, Allen, DeKalb, Kosciusko, or Whitley County -- Actively using drugs, in recovery from drug use, or a support person of someone using drugs

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization seeking to strengthen support systems through mentoring, empowerment, and advocacy of those needing recovery support services.
service_description: Provides educational workshops related to substance use disorder (SUD). Covered topics include understanding addiction; overdose signs, symptoms, and intervention; proper Naloxone/Narcan administration; recovery pathways; and harm reduction strategies.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Training may be requested via the form at www.projectme-fw.org/requestsupport, through private message on the agency’s Facebook page, email, phone, or text. -- Staff will respond within 48 hours to coordinate training; calendar is usually scheduled four (4) weeks out.
site_eligibility: Living in Adams, Allen, DeKalb, Kosciusko, or Whitley County

agency_name: INDIANA FAMILY AND SOCIAL SERVICES ADMINISTRATION - LONG-TERM CARE OMBUDSMAN PROGRAM
agency_desc: A division of the Indiana Family and Social Services Administration that advocates for residents of Indiana long-term care facilities, which includes nursing facilities and licensed assisted living facilities, to promote and protect resident rights guaranteed under federal and state law.
site_name: LONG-TERM CARE OMBUDSMAN PROGRAM OF NORTHEAST INDIANA
service_description: Receives, investigates, and attempts to resolve problems or complaints involving residents of long-term care facilities (nursing facilities, residential care facilities, assisted-living facilities, adult foster care homes, and county residential care facilities) located in Adams, Allen, DeKalb, Huntington, Lagrange, Noble, Steuben, Wells, and Whitley County.
site_details: Call for information, advocacy, referrals, or to make a complaint.
site_eligibility: Persons with questions or complaints about long-term care facilities located in Adams, Allen, DeKalb, Huntington, LaGrange, Noble, Steuben, Wells, or Whitley County

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that offers a one-stop center for those seeking services like counseling, healthcare and family support.
service_description: Provides a “No Wrong Door” access center where trained navigators greet individuals, assess their needs, and assist getting them connected to onsite partner agencies or partner agencies in the community for a broad range of social needs; such as counseling/mental health services, family support services, food support, healthcare/insurance, housing, and more. Staff are also able to assist with filling out forms and applications to apply for services such as SNAP, Medicare/Medicaid, and the Housing Authority. Emergency short-term supplies are also available onsite, such as bags of food, hygiene supplies, and diapers. Spanish and Burmese speaking navigators are available.
site_details: Walk in or call for information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization providing transitional housing for men released from incarceration and on probation or parole.

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides resources and other opportunities to low-income individuals in communities in Northeast Indiana.
service_description: Provides an entry-point for individuals and families who are homeless or at-risk-of homelessness to receive services as part of a community-wide effort to end homelessness. Offers an assessment and referral to a variety of services including outreach programs, shelters, transitional housing, and permanent housing.
site_details: Call to complete the initial assessment. Leave voicemail message for a return call.
site_schedule: Mon-Thurs 8am-4:30pm; hours of operation may vary by program and location
site_eligibility: Living in Adams, Allen, DeKalb, Huntington, Lagrange, Noble, Steuben, Wells, and Whitley Counties -- Homeless (living on the street, unable to obtain shelter, or living in uninhabitable conditions) -- Veterans experiencing or facing homelessness

site_eligibility: Ages 3-5 years (Age 3 by August 1st) -- At or below 100% Federal Poverty Level

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides resources and other opportunities to low-income individuals in communities in Northeast Indiana.
service_description: Provides child care vouchers for low-income families who are working or in school. Families under 100% of the federal poverty level may receive free child care; families between 100-127% of the poverty level may receive child care at a sliding-scale rate.
site_details: Download the CCDF Pre-Application form from the website (www.mybrightpoint.org), or call for an application by mail. -- Submit completed form and required documentation in person, by mail, or by fax. -- After application is reviewed, applicants will be contacted to schedule an individual appointment. -- After the individual appointment, approved applicants will be placed on a wait list or informed of open enrollment events for their region.
site_eligibility: Living in Adams, Allen, DeKalb, Elkhart, Fulton, Huntington, Jay, Kosciusko, Lagrange, Marshall, Noble, Pulaski, St. Joseph, Steuben, Wabash, Wells or Whitley County -- Parents of children birth through age 12 (or up to 18, if child is disabled) -- Working or enrolled in school -- Income under 127% federal poverty guideline -- Child receiving assistance must be a US Citizen or qualified legal alien [Note: Some requirements may be waived for licensed foster parents seeking care for foster children, or for parents with a referral from the Department of Child Services (DCS) or from TANF/IMPACT].

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides resources and other opportunities to low-income individuals in communities in Northeast Indiana.
service_description: Serves as an application and recertification site for the Section 8 Housing Choice Voucher program in Allen (outside city limits of Fort Wayne), DeKalb, Elkhart (outside city limits of Elkhart and Goshen) County, Fulton, Kosciusko (outside city limits of Warsaw), LaGrange, Marshall, Noble, Steuben, and Whitley. Housing Choice Vouchers help eligible households pay the rent on privately owned homes of their choosing (property owners must agree to program participation).  The wait list for Housing Choice Vouchers in Fort Wayne is currently OPEN. People already on the wait list must keep their contact information current to remain on the list.
site_details: Housing Choice Voucher wait list for Fort Wayne is currently OPEN. Applications will be accepted online. --Paper applications will only be available as a reasonable accommodation for disabled individuals because of their disability. To request a reasonable accommodation, please call. -- Those already on the wait list should call to update information as needed.
site_schedule: Mon-Thurs 8am-4:30pm; hours of operation may vary by program and location
site_eligibility: When the wait list is open, income guidelines will be posted. Preference is given to seniors, persons with disabilities, and working families.

site_name: CATHOLIC CHARITIES OF FORT WAYNE-SOUTH BEND - FORT WAYNE
service_description: Provides resettlement and case management services to refugees. Support services and case management are available to help find employment and access health care for newly arriving refugees.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment.
site_schedule: Mon and Thurs 8am-5pm; Tues and Wed 8am-8pm; Fri 8am-noon
site_eligibility: Newly arrived refugees

agency_desc: A government agency that administers housing assistance programs for the city of Fort Wayne and Decatur.
service_description: Maintains and operates twelve public housing complexes for eligible families, seniors, and persons with disabilities. Applications are currently being accepted. A wait list is maintained when all units are full. Rent amount is equal to 30% of the resident's adjusted gross income.
site_details: Applications will be accepted online. Paper applications will only be available as a reasonable accommodation for disabled individuals because of their disability. -- Those already on the wait list should visit the website update information as needed -OR- walk in.
site_eligibility: Low income -- US citizens and eligible immigrants -- Meet low-income guidelines from eligible income sources such as employment (not temporary),   pension, Social Security, SSI, SSD -- Satisfactory criminal history; ask for information.

agency_desc: A government agency that administers housing assistance programs for the city of Fort Wayne and Decatur.
service_description: Serves as an application and re-certification site for the Section 8 Housing Choice Voucher program in the city of Fort Wayne and Decatur. Housing Choice Vouchers help eligible households pay the rent on privately owned homes of their choosing (property owners must agree to program participation). The wait list for Housing Choice Vouchers in this area is currently OPEN. People already on the wait list must keep their contact information current to remain on the list.
site_details: Housing Choice Voucher wait list for Fort Wayne and Decatur is currently OPEN. Applications will be accepted online. Paper applications will only be available as a reasonable accommodation for disabled individuals because of their disability. -- Those already on the wait list should visit the website update information as needed -OR- walk in.
site_eligibility: When the wait list is open, income guidelines will be posted. Preference is given to seniors, persons with disabilities, and working families.

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that offers a transitional housing service and accepted vehicle donations.
service_description: Provides transitional housing and support services to male veterans recovering from drug or alcohol abuse. In-house services include counseling, case management, work therapy, support groups, employment services, continued education, budgeting classes, and veterans benefit assistance. Detoxification may be completed after admission. Transportation is available, as needed.
taxonomy_name: Transitional Residential Substance Use Disorder Services
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
nameLevel3: Transitional Residential Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call for an intake appointment.
site_eligibility: Veterans, with discharge other than dishonorable -- Men, age 18 and older -- Homeless or chemically dependent, recovering from substance abuse -- Satisfactory criminal history (no sex offenders) -- Vetted by Veterans administration -- Only 3 visits in a lifetime allowed

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides information to people with disabilities to address common problems and remove barriers in their communities.
service_description: Offers a statewide disability news and information service covering legislation, housing, transportation, education, and fundraisers. Assists members and other organizations to organize and coordinate advocacy projects that solve disability issues and problems.
taxonomy_name: Protection and Advocacy for Individuals With Disabilities
nameLevel4: Protection and Advocacy for Individuals With Disabilities
site_details: Call for information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A Hope Center exists to provide life transforming services related to pregnancy and sexual integrity.
service_name: EARN WHILE YOU LEARN - HOBSON ROAD
service_description: Provides a parenting education program with incentives offered at each session. Topics include child care, budgeting, health and safety, discipline, and more. Participants earn coupons that may be used to purchase cribs, car seats, baby furniture, maternity and infant clothing, and other new baby supplies.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment to register.
site_eligibility: Pregnant women  -OR- parents of a baby under 12 months

agency_desc: A Hope Center exists to provide life transforming services related to pregnancy and sexual integrity.
service_description: Offers limited ultrasound, pregnancy tests and written confirmation of pregnancy required for ongoing prenatal and maternity care and benefits. Assistance is available to enroll in prenatal Medicaid. Referrals to adoption and other abortion alternatives are provided; information about childbirth, newborn care, and parenting; and free screenings for sexually transmitted infections (STI), such as chlamydia and gonorrhea. Ongoing peer counseling with trained volunteer advocates is available.
site_details: Walk-ins accepted; appointments preferred.
site_eligibility: Open (Age 18 and under must have parental consent for pregnancy testing )

agency_desc: A Hope Center exists to provide life transforming services related to pregnancy and sexual integrity.
service_description: Offers peer-counseling for young and adult women who previously terminated their pregnancy. The group provides peer-support and open discussion on their feelings about abortion.
site_details: Call for scheduling information.
site_eligibility: Persons who experienced an abortion

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides tools and opportunities to those seeking gainful employment.
service_description: Provides discounted professional clothing to those in need. Other general clothing items may include pants, shirts, jackets, purses, belts, ties, and shoes. Available sizes and styles vary based on donations. People who have been referred by a social service agency or case work may redeem items with vouchers.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides tools and opportunities to those seeking gainful employment.
service_description: Provides training of basic soft skills and tools that are required to successfully apply for and secure employment, and retain a position once hired. Service is available to anyone who lacks education, employment, housing, transportation, work experience, or with a disability, mental illness, or addiction. Participants may receive professional clothing for interviews and for employment. A 30-minute orientation must be attended to sign up for training.
site_details: Call 260-744-1900 to schedule an orientation.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 8:30am-4:30pm -- Intake/Orientation: Tues 2pm; Thurs 2pm; Fri 2pm
site_eligibility: Unemployed, underemployed, or displaced workers -- Age 18 or older

agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
service_description: Serves as an official testing center for Indiana's high school equivalency test, which enables people who did not complete high school to earn a high school equivalency diploma. Testing at this location takes place bi-monthly and is available in computer format.
site_details: Call to register for the test. Test takers under age 18 must be accompanied by a parent or guardian to register for the test. Payment due at registration.
site_eligibility: Have lived in Indiana for at least 30 days -- Age 18 or older (recommended); ages 16-17 may be eligible to take the test  with a letter of recommendation signed by a superintendent of an Indiana public  school system -- Not enrolled in high school

agency_name: HABITAT FOR HUMANITY OF GREATER FORT WAYNE
agency_desc: A nonprofit Christian housing ministry that builds affordable housing for qualified individuals and families in Allen, Huntington, and Wells Counties.
site_name: HABITAT FOR HUMANITY OF GREATER FORT WAYNE - CORPORATE
service_description: Builds homes for eligible low-income persons in Allen, Huntington, and Wells County. Participants contribute a set number of hours of labor ("sweat equity") toward the construction of a dwelling that they may then purchase through a zero-interest, low monthly payment loan. Volunteer opportunities are also available for interested individuals and service groups.
site_details: Call or visit the website for application information. -- Consent to background and sex offender registry checks. -- Attend homeowner education classes.
site_eligibility: Lived or worked in Allen, Huntington, or Wells County for the past 12 months -- Meet income guidelines; visit website or call for specific amounts -- Not experienced a foreclosure or filed bankruptcy in last two (2) years -- Agree to complete sweat equity hours -- Pass background and sex offender registry checks

service_description: Provides case management focused on sustained recovery from substance use disorder, substance misuse, and/or opioid/stimulant use disorder. Also provides family support line to provide education, support, and resources to the family and friends of someone struggling with substance use.
site_details: Call to complete a pre-screening.
site_eligibility: Living in Allen County -- Age 18 or older -- At risk of or has been diagnosed with substance use disorder, substance misuse and/or opioid/stimulant use disorder -- Currently receiving MAT (Medication-Assisted Treatment) or has a minimum of 30 days sobriety -- Resourcing and referrals are available for those outside of Allen County or families of individuals under the age of 18.

agency_desc: A non-commerical clinic in Allen County that offers discounted hearing screenings, lower cost hearing apparatus, and sliding-scale fees to people in need.
service_description: Provides hearing aids, hearing screenings, and testing to all ages. Evaluation and screenings are discounted based on income. site_details: Call for information and appointments.
site_eligibility: With hearing impairments -- At or below 250% of the Federal Poverty Level -- Uninsured or underinsured -- If Head of Household is working, up to 400% above poverty level

agency_desc: A nonprofit, community-based food pantry serving those in need.

site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Living in Northeast Indiana -- Household income at or below the Emergency Food Assistance Program guidelines

agency_desc: A church with worship services and a charitable community outreach, including crisis pregnancy support.
service_description: Provides a support group for teen girls and women during a crisis pregnancy to share their experience in a safe place. Support staff offer guidance from a pro-life perspective and assist in finding resources to help with immediate needs.
site_details: Visit website or call for information.
site_eligibility: Expecting mothers (of any age) -- In financial hardship or lack personal support

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including food vouchers and limited emergency financial assistance.
service_name: FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE - ST VINCENT DE PAUL
service_description: Provides emergency financial assistance to households in need of help with rent and utilities, pending disconnect or already disconnected. Applicants must first visit their township trustee. Returning applicants must wait at least 60 days. Funds are limited and based on assessment.
site_details: Walk in during designated hour for an assessment.
site_schedule: Mon and Thurs 11am-1pm; monthly last Mon 6pm-7pm; or by appointment
site_eligibility: In financial hardship (based on assessment) -- Not received assistance in the past 60 days -- Applied with the township trustee

site_name: PARKVIEW BEHAVIORAL HEALTH INSTITUTE - PARK CENTER
service_description: Offers outpatient treatment for adults and youth experiencing a mental health issue or psychiatric disorder, such as anger management, anxiety, attention deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD), bi-polar disorder, depression, post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), or schizophrenia. Case management, psychiatric medication services, home-based services, community-based psychiatric rehabilitation, supported employment services, and residential programs are available to eligible clients receiving treatment from this center.

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that offers mammograms to women.
service_description: Provides mobile mammography services in Adams, Allen, DeKalb, Elkhart, Huntington,  Kosciusko, Lagrange, Noble, Steuben, Wabash, Wells, and Whitley County. Screenings may take up to 15 minutes. Financial assistance is available for those who qualify; appointments preferred.
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment or visit the website to view the coach schedule.
site_eligibility: Women, age 35 or older --  Not had a mammogram in the past year -- Have visited a primary care doctor or clinic in the past 2 years -- No prior or current history of breast cancer or related problems (Breast cancer survivors greater than 5 years are welcomed)

agency_desc: A nonprofit health network offering hospitals, physicians, and specialty services.
service_description: Offers assessments and therapy for children with autism. Available services include one-on-one sessions to those who show characteristics of autism or have autism.
site_details: Call for information or to schedule an intake assessment.
site_eligibility: Age 18 months-7 years-old -- With a diagnosis of Autistic Spectrum Disorder (ASD) -OR- referred by a physician

agency_desc: A nonprofit health network offering hospitals, physicians, and specialty services.
service_description: Provides referrals to Parkview Health network physicians and services. An online tool for finding doctors by location, specialty, type of insurance accepted, language spoken, and gender is also available.
site_details: Call or go to website and click "Find a Doctor."
site_eligibility: Open; referrals limited to physicians within the Parkview network

agency_desc: A nonprofit health network offering hospitals, physicians, and specialty services.
service_description: Offers an acute, inpatient unit and outpatient behavioral health services for children, adolescents, and adults of all ages suffering from emotional, behavioral, or chemical dependency issues. Treatments are available for diagnoses including depression, anxiety, post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), mood disorders, chemical dependency, severe mental illnesses, and geriatric psychotherapy. Visitation varies by the unit.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: For admission, call to schedule an appointment for an initial assessment. -- Emergency rooms are available after-hours. -- For visitation, call for information on visiting schedule.
site_eligibility: Open to all ages (based on assessment)

agency_desc: A nonprofit health network offering hospitals, physicians, and specialty services.
service_description: Provides a series of community health fairs held in various locations throughout the Fort Wayne area, providing free health screenings, low-cost labs and interactive learning centers. Free health checks at all locations include: blood pressure,height/weight/BMI measurements, and vision. Select locations may also offer free health checks for bone density, hearing and balance.  Low-cost lab work includes lipid profile, comprehensive methobolic profile, hemogram, hemoglobin A1C, thyroid stimulation hormone (TSH), and Prostate Specific Antigen (PSA).
site_details: Visit website for current schedule and locations. -- Walk in for free tests available at all sites. -- Call for information regarding tests provided at select sites. -- Fasting is recommended for 10-12 hours prior to having labs drawn; check with physician prior to fasting if have diabetes. -- Call to schedule an appointment for a mammography.
site_eligibility: Age 18 or older

agency_desc: A nonprofit health network offering hospitals, physicians, and specialty services.
service_description: Provides financial assistance for persons who received care from a Parkview Health provider. Persons unable to pay their medical bills may be eligible for full or partial financial assistance based on their income. Applications are also available from financial counselors located at all Parkview Health hospitals.
site_details: Patients MUST submit an application for financial assistance in order to be considered for assistance. -- Call the Patient Financial Services office or contact a financial counselor at any Parkview Health hospital to request a Financial Assistance Application. -- The Financial Assistance Application may also be printed online.
site_eligibility: Received, receiving, or planning to receive medically necessary health care services from a Parkview Health provider (or guarantor of someone who received such services) -- Low to moderate income (below 200% of Federal Poverty Level may be eligible for free care.)

agency_desc: A faith-based, nonprofit agency in Fort Wayne that provides a community thrift store, and charitable outreach for persons in need of household items.
service_description: Provides free, donated furniture and household items to persons in need. Must have referring agency or case worker call to request a voucher. All clients must have a home visit and assessment by the referring agency. Assistance is provided once in a lifetime. Selections vary by donation and there is no guarantee for specific items.
site_details: Referring agency or case worker must call to request an application. -- Following a home-visit and assessment with their client, an appointment will be scheduled for eligible clients to shop for free items.
site_schedule: Tues and Thurs 9am-4pm; voucher clients must arrive before 3pm
site_eligibility: Living in Adams, Allen, DeKalb, Huntington, Noble, Wells, or Whitley County -- Referred by a social service agency -- Experiencing financial hardship -- Not received assistance from this program before

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides transitional, residential housing program for men and women who are recovering from addiction. Outpatient treatment services are also available.

Services include daily meals, daily living skills education, resume preparation, addiction therapy, and medical transportation.

taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
nameLevel3: Transitional Residential Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call for information and availability.
site_eligibility: Individuals age 18 or older -- Recovering from alcohol or drug addiction -- Minimum detoxification of 72 hours -- No prior sex offenses or violent offenses -- Willing to follow program rules -- Be physically able to perform daily life functions

site_details: Call for more information or download application from the website and mail in.
site_eligibility: Open -- Persons with major medical or physical disabilities, or those who may not be aware of emergency    warnings due to hearing or mobility issues

agency_name: THE YMCA OF GREATER FORT WAYNE
agency_desc: A nonprofit organization offering various social, recreational, and fitness programs.
site_name: YMCA OF THE GREATER FORT WAYNE AREA
service_description: Offers programs for all ages, including all-season sports, weight-lifting, aerobics, swimming lessons, and water aerobics. Members pay dues for open access to the fitness center, fitness classes, indoor pool, sauna, and outdoor aquatic center and receive discounted rates for special programs. Nonmembers pay fixed fees for classes.

site_eligibility: Open; membership not required for most programs, but members do receive discounts on fees.

agency_desc: A nonprofit faith-based organization that provides emergency shelter for families, men, and women with children.
service_description: Provides shelter for families or pregnant women. Children may be up to age 18, regardless of gender. site_eligibility: Homeless families with children -- Agree to background check and drug screen

agency_name: INASMUCH MINISTRY AND FAMILY OF CHURCHES
agency_desc: A coalition of 28 churches that provides help with food, clothing, and limited financial assistance based on an action letter from a township trustee.
site_name: INASMUCH MINISTRY AND FAMILY OF CHURCHES
service_description: Offers limited financial assistance with rent and utilities to eligible individuals and families in need. Rent and utility deposits may be assisted on a case-by-case basis. An action letter from the client's township trustee is required, and applicants must complete requirements before receiving assistance.
site_details: Walk in door 11 for assistance.  -- Requirements vary and may include one or more of the following: raising the reminder of the money required; creating a budget form, turning in job applications; attending Bible study; attendance at church services; and proof of application to other agencies.
site_eligibility: With Township Trustee Action Letter (not more than 30 days old; must be in client's name) -- Singles, single-parent families or married couples with or without children (marriage certificate required.) -- Able to successfully complete action plan provided by this agency (may include completing job applications, attending church/Bible study, and/or raising a portion of the money needed) -- Not received assistance from this agency within the past 6 months (for second request)  or within the past year (for third or more request)

agency_desc: A nonprofit child and family advocacy agency with services throughout Indiana.
site_name: THE VILLAGES - NORTHEAST INDIANA - FORT WAYNE
service_description: Offers statewide virtual training for persons interested in becoming licensed for foster care. Foster parents receive 24-hour staff support, counseling services, financial reimbursement, support groups, and respite care. Eligible candidates must be physically and emotionally able to handle challenges presented. Both single persons and married couples are welcome.
site_details: Visit website to complete online interest form, register for upcoming pre-service training dates, or call for information.
site_eligibility: Age 21 or older -- Able to pass a criminal history, child abuse, and sexual abuse registry check -- Able to meet state foster care licensing requirements

agency_desc: County veterans service officers are veterans employed by the county to act as liaisons with county residents for veteran issues, including but not limited to; providing forms, information, and assistance in obtaining state and federal veterans benefits.

site_eligibility: Veteran -- surviving spouses -- children of a veteran

agency_desc: Provides maintenance services on public roads and streets.
service_description: Maintains county roadways in Allen County, including patching, paving, snow removal, street sweeping, roadside mowing, and drainage along roadways. Offers sandbags to Allen County households during times of flooding.

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Represents the state of Indiana in all felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions resulting from crimes committed in Allen County. The prosecutor's office also conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic laws, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
site_details: Varies; call for details.
site_eligibility: Varies by service

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Investigates allegations of abuse, neglect, self-neglect, and exploitation of endangered adults (adults who are incapable of caring for themselves or managing their property due to physical or mental incapacity.) Indiana law requires persons to report all cases of suspected abuse, neglect, or exploitation of an endangered adult to the nearest Adult Protective Services office or to law enforcement agents. All reports are confidential.
site_details: Call for to make a report; provide as much detail about the situation as possible. -- For emergencies or after-hours reports, please call local police or county dispatch.
site_eligibility: Persons who suspect abuse, neglect, self-neglect, or exploitation of an endangered adult.

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Files, modifies, and enforces court-ordered child support cases in Allen County.
site_details: To apply for child support or request child support enforcement or modification, call the prosecutor's office to schedule an appointment. -- For payment information, call the Kids Line.
site_schedule: Child Support Office: Mon-Fri 8am-11:30pm and 1pm-4pm -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm
site_eligibility: To File for Child Support Assistance: Living in Allen County -- Parent, guardian, aunt, uncle, or grandparent who has physical custody     of a child (ages 0-18) -- Requiring financial support from a noncustodial parent of the child

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services and maintains the correctional facility for Allen County.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime prevention, and criminal investigation services and administers county correctional facilities in Allen County. service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime prevention, and criminal investigation services and administers county correctional facilities in Allen County. Operates a 24-hour dispatch service for police officers, firefighters, and medics (ambulances) in Allen County. A ten-digit dispatch number is provided for nonemergency dispatch calls. For emergency assistance, persons should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency police, fire, or medical assistance. For nonemergency requests or reports, call the office during normal business hours. nonemergency dispatch number.
site_eligibility: Open; serves Allen County

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services and maintains the correctional facility for Allen County.
address_2: Room B-25 - Charles "bud" Meeks Justice Center
service_description: Provides limited criminal background histories for personal use, pre-employment checks, and certain other uses. Histories show only arrests made in Allen County. Ink fingerprinting service is available to the public.
site_details: Call or walk in. Electronic Fingerprinting is by appointment only; call or visit the website.
site_eligibility: Case Records (Incident Reports): Open; limited to incidents occurring in Allen County -- Criminal History Records: Persons requesting their own histories, for personal use or to be  sent for pre-employment or other verification

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services and maintains the correctional facility for Allen County.
service_description: Maintains then Allen County correctional institution used to detain persons who are in lawful custody, including accused persons awaiting trial and those who have been convicted of a crime and are serving a sentence of less than one year.
site_details: Call or visit the website for scheduling details.
site_eligibility: Must be on inmate's approved vistor list -- Age 18 or older (or accompanied by someone over 18 who is also on the inmate's visitor list)

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing family, civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Oversees both criminal and civil trials, including juvenile and family cases, in Allen County.
site_details: Varies; cases are generally initiated through the prosecutor's office, private attorneys -- individuals representing themselves.
site_eligibility: Persons named in cases or called for jury duty at this court

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing family, civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Handles civil lawsuits for $6,000 or less, including contracts, collection of rent, evictions, and personal loans. Only corporations are required to be represented by an attorney and only on claims over $1,500.
site_details: Walk in to file a claim.
site_eligibility: To file a lawsuit: Age 18 or older and  having a civil claim for less than $6,000 -- Meeting one of the following three requirements: Person being sued lives or works in Allen County -OR- Matter resulting in lawsuit took place in Allen County  -OR- Matter resulting in lawsuit was to be performed in Allen County

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing family, civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Handles civil lawsuits for $6,000 or less, including contracts, collection of rent, evictions, and personal loans. Only corporations are required to be represented by an attorney and only on claims over $1,500.
site_details: Walk in to file a claim.
site_eligibility: To file a lawsuit: Age 18 or older and  having a civil claim for less than $6,000 -- Meeting one of the following three requirements: Person being sued lives or works in Allen County -OR- Matter resulting in lawsuit took place in Allen County  -OR- Matter resulting in lawsuit was to be performed in Allen County

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing family, civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Provides probation services for the Allen County Circuit and Superior Courts, including supervising adult offenders in the community and linking them with programs and services to support their rehabilitation.
site_details: Through the courts; call for details.
site_eligibility: Adult offenders assigned to probation

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing family, civil and criminal cases.
site_name: ALLEN COUNTY JUVENILE CENTER - NORTH CENTER
service_description: Oversees court cases involving Allen County minors, including petitions for emancipation, children in need of services (CHINS), and minors accused of delinquency or status offenses.
site_details: By court order; parents cannot self-refer children to juvenile court
site_eligibility: Allen County juveniles age 17 and under

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing family, civil and criminal cases.
site_name: ALLEN COUNTY JUVENILE CENTER - NORTH CENTER
service_description: Provides probation services for the Allen County Circuit and Superior Courts, including supervising juvenile offenders in the community and linking them with programs and services to support their rehabilitation.
site_details: Through the courts; call for details.
site_eligibility: Juvenile offenders assigned to probation

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing family, civil and criminal cases.
site_name: ALLEN COUNTY JUVENILE PROBATION - SOUTH CENTER
service_description: Provides probation services for the Allen County Circuit and Superior Courts, including supervising juvenile offenders in the community and linking them with programs and services to support their rehabilitation.
site_details: Through the courts; call for details.
site_eligibility: Juvenile offenders assigned to probation

site_name: ALLEN COUNTY JUVENILE PROBATION - EAST CENTER
service_description: Provides probation services for the Allen County Circuit and Superior Courts, including supervising juvenile offenders in the community and linking them with programs and services to support their rehabilitation.

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: Offers free clothing for individuals and families in need. Sizes range from infant to adult.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: Offers a food pantry to residents of Wayne Township in Allen County.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Living in Wayne Township -- Limit one visit per year

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities; administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration; issues marriage licenses; and records state tax liens in Allen County.
service_description: Processes court-ordered child support payments in the county and provides records of payment history. Payer and payee must keep their names and addresses current with this office; any changes must be made in writing.
site_details: Payment history print out: Walk in to obtain. -- Update name/address: Walk in or mail changes. -- Payment Information: Visit website or call the Indiana Kids Line.
site_schedule: Clerk's Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4:30pm -- Indiana Kids Line: Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm
site_eligibility: Parents ordered by the court to pay or receive child support

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities; administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration; issues marriage licenses; and records state tax liens in Allen County.
service_description: Issues, provides, and maintains  marriage licenses issued in the county. No witnesses, blood tests, or waiting period are required to obtain one. Both applicants must appear at the time of application. Marriages must take place within 60 days of the marriage license being issued.
site_details: Walk in. -- Marriage license forms may be completed in advance online or in the clerk's office.
site_eligibility: Marriage license: Both parties at least age 18 (call or visit website for exceptions) -- At least one applicant from this county -OR- both from out of state -- Certified copies: License must have been issued in this county

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities; administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration; issues marriage licenses; and records state tax liens in Allen County.
service_description: Maintains records of all county-level court cases, and issues marriage licenses. Files petitions for divorce, probate, adoption, name change, child custody, parental visitation, record expungement, and protective orders. Processes payments for child support, foreclosures, court costs, and other judgments. Oversees elections in the county.
site_details: Call or walk in for information.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; serves Allen County

agency_desc: A nonprofit law firm that provides free civil legal assistance to eligible low-income people throughout Indiana. "ILS helps clients who are faced with legal problems that harm their ability to have such basics as food, shelter, income, medical care or personal safety."
service_description: Provides legal guidance and representation to low-income individuals in civil matters, such as family law, senior law, consumer law, housing issues, and public benefits. Preference is given to legal problems that prevent clients from meeting their basic needs. No criminal or fee-generating cases accepted.
site_details: Call during service hours to begin the application process. Be prepared to answer questions about household income and assets.
site_eligibility: Able to meet income guidelines; generally 125% of Federal Poverty Level -- With a civil legal issue that does not generate fees

agency_desc: A nonprofit law firm that provides free civil legal assistance to eligible low-income people throughout Indiana. "ILS helps clients who are faced with legal problems that harm their ability to have such basics as food, shelter, income, medical care or personal safety."

site_eligibility: Serves the Fort Wayne and New Haven area -- Passengers physically or mentally unable to use fixed route service -- Written referral from physician

site_schedule: Office: Mon-Thurs 8am-7:30pm; Fri 8am-2pm -- Mentoring: Weekends, evenings, and out-of-school times.

service_description: Assists seniors and persons with disabilities in applying for and accessing funding for supportive living services. Funding options may include Medicaid Waivers, CHOICE vouchers, or block grants. Ongoing case management, care coordination, and in-home services are provided for those who qualify. In some cases, subsidies may be used to pay a family member to provide the care.

agency_desc: A government agency assuring Indiana families with infants and toddlers experiencing developmental delays or disabilities have access to early intervention services close to home when they need them through a coordinated system of local inter-agency councils called First Steps.
site_name: FIRST STEPS OF NORTH CENTRAL INDIANA - CLUSTER C
service_description: Serves as an entry point for infants and toddlers who have or are at risk for developmental delays. Services include home-based special instruction; occupational, physical, and speech therapy; access to health and social services; and case management.

site_details: Call for information or to schedule an appointment.

agency_desc: A nonprofit membership association for dentists that provides dental referrals to those in need.

site_details: Visit website for information or referrals. -- For online dentist listings, click "Find A Dentist" in the upper far right corner of the home page.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Thurs 8am-4pm -- Online Dental Referrals: Daily 24 hours
site_eligibility: Living in Adams, Allen, DeKalb, Huntington, Jay, Lagrange, Noble, Steuben, Wells, or Whitley County

agency_desc: A commercial agency providing outpatient services including counseling and medication for those with opioid dependence.
service_description: Provides outpatient services to individuals who are addicted to opioid drugs (including opium, morphine, codeine products, heroin, oxycodone, and hydrocodone). Services include medications, counseling, education, and referral to other agencies as needed. Group, individual, and family addictions counseling is available (while addict is present).

taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services

site_name: BUREAU OF DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES SERVICES - DISTRICT 3
service_name: HOME AND COMMUNITY BASED MEDICAID WAIVERS / CAREGIVER SUPPORT SERVICES - DISTRICT 3
service_description: Provides funding for home and residential care services to enable persons with developmental disabilities to live as independently as possible. Client services include developmental evaluation; case management; and referrals to supported living, sheltered employment, and home-care providers. There is a wait list for Medicaid Waivers; however, caregiver support services funds may be available in the meantime.
site_details: Call for information or to request an application.
site_eligibility: With a developmental disability, including intellectual disability, cerebral palsy, epilepsy, autism, down syndrome, or a condition that results in a similar impairment -- Onset for the condition was prior to age 22 -- The disability creates substantial functional limitations (determined by assessment)

agency_name: VOLUNTEER LAWYER PROGRAM OF NORTHEAST INDIANA
agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides pro bono legal services for low-income individuals.
site_name: VOLUNTEER LAWYER PROGRAM OF NORTHEAST INDIANA
service_description: Provides free, legal representation and processing to low-income individuals and families to obtain guardianship for someone who is mentally incapacitated or who is no longer able to make their own personal care decisions. Court-appointed guardians may be assumed by trained volunteers, when necessary and if available. Services will not be provided for emergency hearings.
site_details: Call for initial intake assessment.
site_eligibility: Household income at or below 200% Federal Poverty Level -- Family or caregiver of person who is incompetent of self-care, due to aging or disability -- Applying for a person who is currently or will be living in a residential care facility

agency_name: VOLUNTEER LAWYER PROGRAM OF NORTHEAST INDIANA
agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides pro bono legal services for low-income individuals.
site_name: VOLUNTEER LAWYER PROGRAM OF NORTHEAST INDIANA
service_description: Provides legal guidance and representation to low-income individuals in civil matters, such as family law, senior law, consumer law, and housing issues. Preference is given to legal issues that limit a person from meeting their basic needs. No criminal or fee-generating cases accepted. Services will not be provided for emergency hearings.
site_details: Call for initial intake assessment. -- Be prepared to provide information about total household income.
site_eligibility: At or below 200% Federal Poverty Level -- Civil matters only

service_description: Provides advocacy, information, referrals, and support services to victims of domestic violence, sexual assault, and human trafficking. service_description: Provides emergency shelter to persons and families in crisis who are fleeing a domestic violence situation. Length of stay is determined on a case by case basis. Residents have access to food, clothing, and personal hygiene items. Services include case management, advocacy, support groups, homework help for youth, and referrals to other community resources. Transportation may be available.

site_schedule: Intake: Daily 24 hours -- Crisis Line: Daily 24 hours
site_eligibility: Women and men, with or without children -- Fleeing a domestic violent situation

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization working to combat food insecurity through food distribution to partner pantries and individuals in need throughout northeastern Indiana.

Alternating Wed 10am-noon -- 2023: Jan 11 and 25, 
Feb 8 and 22, Mar 8 and 22, Apr 5 and 19, May 3, 17 and 31, Jun 14 and 28, Jul 12 and 26, Aug 9 and 23,Sep 6 and 20, Oct 4 and 18, Nov 1, 15 and 29, Dec 13 and 27
site_eligibility: Age 60 or older

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization working to combat food insecurity through food distribution to partner pantries and individuals in need throughout northeastern Indiana.
service_description: Provides supplemental food to low-income seniors through a partnership with the United States Department of Agriculture (USDA). Monthly packages including animal protein, plant based protein, fruits, vegetables, starches, milk, grains, and cheese. Participants must pickup package from food bank; delivery to seniors who are medically homebound may also be available. Pre-registration is required.
site_details: Call to complete a phone assessment or visit the website to download an application -- A waiting list is maintained when program is at capacity.
site_schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 7:30am-4pm -- Service hours vary; call for details.
site_eligibility: Living in Allen, DeKalb, Huntington, Lagrange, Noble, Steuben, or Whitley County -- Age 60 or older -- With household income at or below 130% of Federal Poverty Level

agency_desc: A nonprofit that provides emotional support and assistance with the daily needs of people with cancer and their families, including financial assistance and healthcare equipment and supplies.
service_description: Provides information and referral on numerous support groups throughout northeastern Indiana that offer education and mutual support for persons with cancer and their families. Other groups welcome persons with any cancer diagnosis.

site_details: Walk in or call for information on scheduled meetings and locations.
site_eligibility: Persons diagnosed with any form of cancer

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization providing home-based case management.

service_description: Provides home-based case management services to help at-risk families with children overcome life challenges. The focus of this program is to strengthen families and protect children by providing preventative programs and connecting families to local resources.
site_details: Call to request service or visit website to complete a referral form.
site_eligibility: With one or more child under age 18 -- Low income, at risk, or in need of services -- Not eligible for the Healthy Families program -- Without an active Child Protective Services case -- Without a child in the home who is currently on juvenile probation

service_description: Provides home-based case management and advocacy services to help families with children overcome life challenges. The focus of this program is to strengthen families and protect children by providing preventative programs and connections to local resources.
site_details: Call for information; no referral necessary. -- A case manager will come to the home to conduct initial assessment.
site_eligibility: Families with children ages 0-17 -- Experiencing challenges (behavioral, financial, or other source of instability) -- Not actively involved with the Department of Child Services (DCS) / Child Protective Services (CPS) or the Healthy Families program -- If a family has a youth with an open Juvenile Probation case and the youth is in an out of home placement, the family may receive services as long as they have other children living in the home.

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization providing home-based case management.
service_description: Offers respite care for children in family crisis, such as possible eviction or homelessness, stress, death of a parent, abuse, neglect, and other emergencies. Volunteer respite homes act as a safe haven for children in crisis and hold foster care licensing. Case management is provided until the child is returned home safely and securely. Stay is limited to seven days.
site_details: Call for assistance and complete a phone assessment. -- A case worker will meet the family in-home or at a secure location to complete required forms.
site_eligibility: Children, ages 12 or younger -- (older children may be considered on case by case) -- Not actively involved with DCS (including CHINS program or receiving CPS services)

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that works to prevent illegal abandonment of newborns by raising awareness, offering a 24-hour hotline for mothers in crisis and offering Safe Haven Baby Boxes as a last resort option for women who want to maintain complete anonymity.
service_description: Offers a 24-hour hotline for mothers in crisis and offers Safe Haven Baby Boxes as a last resort option for women who want to surrender their newborn, but maintain complete anonymity. There are multiple baby box locations throughout the state that are accessible from the outside of the building and are equipped with silent alarms so a newborn can be surrendered with no questions asked.
site_details: Call the hotline for crisis assistance. -- To surrender baby anonymously visit www.shbb.org/locations to find a location.
site_eligibility: For Safe Haven Baby Boxes: Infants 30 days or younger

site_eligibility: Men with a history of physical violence, intimidation, or confinement toward an intimate partner

site_eligibility: Women with children exposed to domestic violence, child abuse, or neglect

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that referred families and individuals who have experienced a catastrophic situation are provided with basic household furniture, linens and kitchenware.
service_description: Provides donated furniture, household, kitchen items to referred clients in need. Assistance is offered once in a lifetime. All clients must have a home visit and assessment by the referring agency prior to receiving an application.  No clothing, baby furniture, exercise equipment, entertainment electronics, computers, or medical equipment are available.
site_details: Referring agency or case worker must call to obtain referral process information. An appointment will be scheduled for eligible clients to pick up items. -- Items must be picked up and taken with client at the time of the appointment. -- Highly recommended to have tarps, tie-downs, and an extra truck for large family sizes
site_eligibility: Referred by a social service agency, faith based church, or school following a home visit to attest to the needs of the household -- Experienced a catastrophic situation -- Not received assistance from this agency more than once in a lifetime

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that facilitates a support group for suicide survivors and families that have lost a loved one to suicide in southwest Fort Wayne.
service_description: Offers a  support group for people who have lost someone to death by suicide. Meetings are held monthly to share experiences while learning to cope with grief and loss.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: Family and friends who have lost a loved one to suicide

agency_desc: A church with a charitable outreach including a food pantry.

agency_name: BUREAU OF REHABILITATION SERVICES - INDIANA DIVISION OF DISABILITY AND REHABILITATIVE SERVICES
agency_desc: A state agency Bureau that serves persons with disabilities so that they may achieve and maintain employment.
service_description: Provides a range of employment services for persons with physical or mental impairment. Applicants receive assessment to determine eligibility and vocational rehabilitation needs. Eligible persons may receive counseling and guidance, referrals to vocational training and placement programs, and funding for rehabilitation services as appropriate to achieve an employment goal.
site_details: Call for information, to apply for services, and/or to discuss your employment needs.
site_eligibility: Have a physical or mental impairment that, based on assessment, constitutes or results in a substantial impediment to employment -- Requiring vocational rehabilitation services to prepare for, enter, engage in, or retain appropriate employment

agency_desc: The state government entity responsible for state tax matters, including collecting state taxes, administering state tax laws, and creating tax policy.
site_name: INDIANA DEPARTMENT OF REVENUE - FORT WAYNE DISTRICT
service_description: Answers questions about state income taxes, provides state tax forms, handles state tax collections and assists with setting up payment arrangements, and submits completed state tax returns (paper filing only). Assistance is provided by phone, email, or on a walk-in basis. Automated information is available 24 hours per day by phone.
site_details: Walk in, call, or send questions by email. -- For phone assistance, follow the phone prompts to hear recorded information by topic   or to speak with a live representative. State or federal tax ID number may be required.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement services for the state of Indiana.
service_description: Conducts state law enforcement and criminal investigations and enforces traffic laws on state highways and interstate expressways. This agency also provides technical and other special assistance to local and federal law enforcement agencies and conducts research and planning regarding law enforcement services in Indiana. This district office serves Benton, Carroll, Clinton, Fountain, Montgomery, Tippecanoe, Warren, and White County.
site_details: Call or visit the website for information or nonemergency assistance. For emergency police assistance, call 9-1-1.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; this district office serves Adams, Allen, Blackford, DeKalb, Huntington, Jay, Lagrange, Noble, Steuben, Wells, and Whitley County.

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that assists volunteers to host homes for families and children in need of crisis child care.
site_name: SAFE FAMILIES FOR CHILDREN - NORTHEAST INDIANA
service_description: Provides crisis and respite care for children whose parents are temporarily unable to care for them due to a short-term emergency, such as hospitalization, or a longer-term crisis, such as drug abuse, incarceration, homelessness, domestic violence, or unemployment. Care is provided in the homes of trained, volunteer host families. Children may stay in a Safe Families home as little as one night or as long as several months.
site_details: Call to begin the intake process. -- Callers will need to explain their family situation and provide each child's medical background and Medicaid number (if applicable). -- Leave a voicemail with family situation and contact information for a return call.
site_eligibility: Living in Adams, Allen, Dekalb, Huntington, Wells, or Whitley County -- Age 0-18 -- Note: Youth with severe behavioral problems may be screened out.

agency_desc: Our mission is to strengthen our communities and to improve the health and well-being of those we are privileged to serve. We use evidence based practices that treat the whole person. agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.

site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.

site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.

site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.

Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.
site_details: Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Confirm correct Trustee by visiting www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address; township is shown as "county subdivision". -- Call to schedule an appointment.
site_eligibility: MUST LIVE IN TOWNSHIP (Visit www.censusreporter.org/locate and type in home address to discover township.) -- With financial need based on assessment -- Able to provide documentation of income and expenses for all household members

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization providing transitional shelter for women with or without children.
service_description: Provides transitional housing for women with or without children. Length of stay limited to one year. Open service area.
site_details: Call for phone interview and to check availability.
site_eligibility: Women -- Age 18 or older -- With or without children (girls any age; boys up to age 12)

agency_desc: A crisis pregnancy organization that provides support and resources to help women in need carry their pregnancies to term.
site_name: WOMEN'S CARE CENTER - LAKE AVENUE FORT WAYNE
service_name: BABY AND MATERNITY ITEMS - LAKE AVENUE FORT WAYNE
service_description: Provides diapers, baby clothing (up to size 5T), and maternity clothing for new and expectant mothers in need. Items are available to clients who attend parenting classes in order to earn coupons for use at Crib Club where they can be redeemed for baby items. Maternity clothing is available without participating in the classes.
site_details: Call to schedule an intake appointment.
site_schedule: Mon and Wed-Fri 9am-5pm; Tues 9am-6pm; Fourth Sat 9am-5pm
site_eligibility: Pregnant women and mothers or fathers of children age 5 or younger

site_name: WOMEN'S CARE CENTER - LAKE AVENUE FORT WAYNE

site_name: WOMEN'S CARE CENTER - LAKE AVENUE FORT WAYNE
service_name: FAMILY PLANNING - LAKE AVENUE FORT WAYNE
service_description: Provides free, walk-in pregnancy testing, pregnancy verification required for medical benefits, and referrals to prenatal care, adoption agencies, and other abortion alternatives for women facing a crisis pregnancy. No referrals are made to abortion service providers.
site_details: Walk-ins accepted; calling ahead is recommended.
site_schedule: Mon and Wed-Fri 9am-5pm; Tues 9am-6pm; Fourth Sat 9am-5pm
site_eligibility: Women

site_name: WOMEN'S CARE CENTER - LAKE AVENUE FORT WAYNE
service_name: BABY FOOD - LAKE AVENUE FORT WAYNE
service_description: Provides a one-time assistance for baby formula during emergencies for families with infants. Recurring assistance is available for those participating in other services at this location.
site_details: Call to schedule a pick-up for baby formula during emergencies.
site_schedule: Mon and Wed-Fri 9am-5pm; Tues 9am-6pm; Fourth Sat 9am-5pm
site_eligibility: With an infant in the household on supplemental feeding -- In emergency or first time seeking assistance from this agency for baby formula

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that provides tutoring to youth with learning difficulties to improve academic skills.
service_description: Provides one-on-one tutoring for children with learning difficulties, to improve reading accuracy, fluency, comprehension, spelling, writing, and mathematics. Offers research-based programs, individualized lesson plans, and ongoing progress evaluations. Tutoring is offered twice weekly on a year-round basis at the main learning center and other locations.
site_details: Call or email for information or to schedule an appointment.
site_schedule: School Year: Mon-Thurs 2:30pm-9pm; Sat 9am-3pm -- Summer: Mon-Fri 8am-9pm; Sat 9am-3pm
site_eligibility: Students in grades PreK-12

agency_desc: A nonprofit agency that provides tutoring to youth with learning difficulties to improve academic skills.
service_description: Provides one-on-one tutoring for children with learning difficulties, to improve reading accuracy, fluency, comprehension, spelling, writing, and mathematics. Offers research-based programs, individualized lesson plans, and ongoing progress evaluations. Tutoring is offered twice weekly on a year-round basis at the main learning center and other locations.
site_details: Call or email for information or to schedule an appointment.
site_schedule: School Year: Mon-Thurs 2:30pm-9pm; Sat 9am-3pm -- Summer: Mon-Fri 8am-9pm; Sat 9am-3pm
site_eligibility: Students in grades PreK-12

agency_desc: An nonprofit, faith-based organization that provides recovery residences for women with a history of trauma, addictions, substance use disorders, and mental health issues.
service_description: Faith-based, recovery residences challenging stigmas in mental health, substance use disorders, and trauma. Utilizing holistic approaches. Services offered include, fee-based, all-inclusive room and board, case management, skills training, recovery coaches, peer support, and leisure activities available. Must be willing to commit to the program for 6-12 months. Referrals are required.
taxonomy_name: Transitional Residential Substance Use Disorder Services
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
nameLevel3: Transitional Residential Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call to schedule an appointment after receiving referral.
site_eligibility: Women, without children -- Ages 18-70 -- Referred from community partners, including Indiana 211 -- History of trauma, addictions, substance use disorder/MAT, and mental health issues

agency_desc: Utility company that provides water and wastewater utility service.
service_description: Provides water services to those who live in Saint Joseph, Lake and Montgomery County and sewage services to portions of Allen, Clark, Crawford, Floyd, Hancock, Hendricks, Huntington, Marion, Morgan, Porter and Whitley County. Handles billing information and responds to reports of a main break or hazardous conditions related to a sewer line.
site_details: Call for assistance; bill can be paid online, in person, by mail, or by phone.  For in person locations see website.
site_eligibility: Addresses within set boundaries

agency_name: UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF VETERANS AFFAIRS
agency_desc: A government program with a mission to provide a broad range of counseling, outreach, and referral services to eligible veterans in order to help them make a satisfying post-war readjustment to civilian life.
site_name: FORT WAYNE VET CENTER- VETERANS HEALTH ADMINISTRATION
service_description: Offers a peer support program using reintegration counseling to help combat veterans and their families cope with stress, transition into civilian life, and reduce barriers to care. Services include individual, marriage, and family counseling, bereavement and military sexual trauma (MST) counseling, and referrals.
taxonomy_category: Mental Health and Substance Use Disorder Services
site_details: Call or walk in during office hours. -- Call to schedule an after hours or weekend appointment.
site_eligibility: United States combat war veterans and their immediate families -- Veterans who experienced military sexual trauma (MST) and Gold Star families

agency_desc: A nonprofit organization that provides a twelve step program to help the family and friends of alcoholics, including Alateen which offers a group for teens living with the effects of a parent's or other relative's problem drinking.
site_name: AL-ANON FAMILY GROUP - FORT WAYNE ALCOHOLICS ANONYMOUS
service_description: Offers support groups for friends and relatives of alcoholics, following the 12-Step model. Al-Anon is for adults; Alateen is for young people. Information about meeting times and locations is available by phone or online. Meetings are on a walk-in basis.
taxonomy_name: Families/Friends of Individuals With an Alcohol Use Disorder Support Groups
nameLevel5: Families/Friends of Individuals With an Alcohol Use Disorder Support Groups
site_details: Walk in, call or visit the website to confirm meeting schedule. -- DURING COVID-19 CRISIS: Call or visit the website to confirm meeting schedule. Some meetings may be offered through zoom or Al-Anon Family Groups App.
site_schedule: Live Operator Assistance: Mon-Fri 8am-5pm -- Meetings: Vary
site_eligibility: Al-Anon: Adult friends or relatives of someone who abuses alcohol -- Alateen: Adolescent, age 13-19 years-old, friends or relatives of someone who abuses alcohol. -- If there are no Alateen meetings locally, they can attend an Al-Anon meeting.

agency_desc: A congressional body of the United States, made up of representatives from each state proportional to population.
service_name: UNITED STATES REPRESENTATIVE - INDIANA'S 3RD DISTRICT - JIM BANKS - REPUBLICAN
service_description: Represents the 3rd Congressional District of northeastern Indiana in the US House of Representatives. Constituents may contact their representatives with questions or concerns about current or pending legislation. Representative's office may be able to help citizens in navigating the complex federal agency system, such as the Social Security Administration, the Department of Veterans Affairs, the Internal Revenue Service, or any other federal agency.
site_details: Call, write, fax, or email questions, comments, concerns, or other feedback. Submit email through the website.
site_schedule: Indiana Office: Mon-Fri 8:30am-5pm -- Washington DC Office: Mon-Fri 9am-5pm
site_eligibility: Correspondence is only accepted from persons living in Third District

agency_desc: A commercial organization that provides home and GPS tracking medical alert devices and trained operators that monitor and dispatch first responders or call pre-arranged emergency contacts 24/7 based on the need. service_description: Provides electronic equipment which connects frail seniors or people who have disabilities with police or other emergency response personnel after a fall, injury, or other medical emergencies. Additional features that are available include smoke and fire detectors.

site_eligibility: Individuals at risk of falls or other injuries -- Individuals at risk of isolation

site_eligibility: Age 5 or older -- Low income; based on assessment -- At-risk students -- Homeless or at risk of becoming homeless

agency_desc: Offers club meetings, camps, and other programs for girls in kindergarten through 12th grade.
site_name: GIRL SCOUTS OF NORTHERN INDIANA-MICHIANA - FORT WAYNE SERVICE CENTER
service_description: Offers club meetings, camps, and other programs for girls in kindergarten through 12th grade. Adult volunteers lead girls in activities designed to build character, develop life and leadership skills, and strengthen self-confidence. Troops in this council meet at various locations throughout northern Indiana.
